content: these socks are made for walking try these for a first pair of socks using thicker yarn makes the socks faster to knit the pattern makes a pair of socks suitable for wearing in work or walking boots as they are a little thicker than 4 ply socks this pattern is worked from the top down and uses the heel flap and turn method to create the heel yarn 100 g 6 ply sock yarn 3 1 needles 3 0 mm either double pointed 0 2 n e needles or circulars for working in the r a l round c a m - n o notions tapestry needle stitch tlim a markers h a n o skills cast on knit purl knitting in the i © f round picking up stitches decreasing stitches weaving in ends grafting gauge 28 sts and 32 row over 10 cm in stocking stitch sizing pattern gives stitch counts for extra small small medium large extra large adult sizes with a finished circumference of 14 15 17 18 20 cm abbreviations k knit k2tog knit two stitches together p purl pm place stitch marker p2tog purl two stitches together round round sl slip_stitch purlwise onto right needle without knitting it sm slip marker from left needle to right ssk slip two stitches knitwise one by one knit these two stitches together sts stitches © f hamilton-maclaren 2013 these socks are made for walking page 1 cast on repeat row 2 and 3 a total of 10 11 12 13 14 times 21 23 25 27 29 row total cast on 40 44 48 52 56 sts using the long tail cast on this method of casting on gives a decent amount of stretch so the sock will fit heel turn over your heel join for knitting in the round placing a stitch short row are used to create the heel turn a marker to show the start of the round cup shaped section of knitting that sits under the heel and changes the direction of your knitted tube cuff a ribbed cuff helps to hold the top of the sock row 1 *sl1 p10 11 13 14 15 p2tog p1 in place on the leg turn work round 1 *k1 p1 repeat from * around row 2 *sl1 k5 5 7 7 7 ssk k1 turn work repeat round 1 10 12 12 15 15 times look carefully at the stitches on the needle you will see a small gap between the decrease from row one and the following stitch leg row 3 *sl1 p to one stitch before the visible gap p2tog p1 turn work the leg is worked in 3 x 1 ribbing to help the sock fit snugly on the leg row 4 *sl1 k to one stitch before the visible gap ssk k1 turn work round 2 *k3 p1 repeat from * to end of round repeat row three and four until all stitches repeat round 2 for 45 50 55
